home.title: ProofCaptcha
home.subtitle: Advanced proof-of-work CAPTCHA system with powerful analytics and seamless integration

features.title: Powerful Features
features.subtitle: Everything you need to protect your application from automated attacks

pow.title: Proof-of-Work Security
pow.description: Advanced cryptographic challenges that require computational work to solve, effectively blocking automated bots

analytics.title: Real-time Analytics
analytics.description: Comprehensive dashboard with verification metrics, success rates, and detailed activity logs

integration.title: Easy Integration
integration.description: Simple API with SDKs for popular frameworks. Get started in minutes with our detailed documentation

encryption.title: End-to-End Encryption
encryption.description: Military-grade AES-256-GCM encryption protects challenge data from inspection and tampering

fingerprint.title: Advanced Fingerprinting
fingerprint.description: Multi-layer device fingerprinting tracks suspicious patterns across sessions and IPs

detection.title: Bot Detection
detection.description: Behavioral analysis and automation detection identify bots before they can attempt challenges

settings.title: Security Settings
settings.description: Configure security features and design options for {{name}}
settings.coreSecurityDescription: Domain validation and end-to-end encryption are always enforced and cannot be disabled. These critical protections ensure your captcha system remains secure.

protectionFeatures.title: Protection Features
protectionFeatures.description: Enable or disable individual security layers

advancedFingerprinting.label: Advanced Fingerprinting
advancedFingerprinting.description: Canvas, WebGL, Audio, and more for bot detection

sessionBinding.label: Session Binding
sessionBinding.description: Prevents token replay across different sessions

csrfProtection.label: CSRF Protection
csrfProtection.description: Guards against cross-site request forgery attacks

ipRateLimiting.label: IP Rate Limiting
ipRateLimiting.description: Limits requests per IP to prevent abuse

riskAdaptiveDifficulty.label: Risk-based Adaptive Difficulty
riskAdaptiveDifficulty.description: Adjusts challenge difficulty based on risk score

antiVpn.label: Anti-VPN Detection
antiVpn.description: Detect and block VPN/Proxy connections to prevent abuse

accessControl.title: Access Control
accessControl.description: Block specific IP addresses or countries from accessing your captcha

blockedIps.label: Blocked IP Addresses
blockedIps.helpText: Comma-separated list. Supports exact IP, wildcards (192.168.*), or CIDR notation (192.168.1.0/24)

blockedCountries.label: Blocked Countries
blockedCountries.helpText: Select countries you want to block from the list

performanceSettings.title: Performance Settings
performanceSettings.description: Configure proof-of-work difficulty and rate limits

powDifficulty.label: Proof-of-Work Difficulty
powDifficulty.helpText: Higher difficulty = more secure but slower solving time

rateLimit.label: Max Requests per Minute
rateLimit.helpText: Maximum challenge requests allowed per IP per minute

challengeDesign.title: Challenge Design
challengeDesign.description: Configure timeouts and enabled challenge types

challengeTimeout.label: Challenge Timeout (seconds)
challengeTimeout.helpText: Time limit for users to solve the challenge

tokenExpiry.label: Token Expiry (seconds)
tokenExpiry.helpText: How long the verification token remains valid after success

enabledTypes.label: Enabled Challenge Types
enabledTypes.atLeastOne: Select at least one challenge type

warnings.title: Security Warning
warnings.description: Are you sure you want to disable this security feature?

antiDebugger.title: Anti-Debugger Protection Disabled
antiDebugger.description: Disabling this feature allows developers to inspect and debug your captcha widget, making it easier for attackers to find vulnerabilities and bypass protection mechanisms.

advancedFingerprinting.title: Advanced Fingerprinting Disabled
advancedFingerprinting.description: Without advanced fingerprinting, bots can more easily evade detection by hiding their true identity. This significantly reduces your ability to identify and block automated attacks.

sessionBinding.title: Session Binding Disabled
sessionBinding.description: Disabling session binding allows attackers to reuse captcha tokens across different sessions, making replay attacks easier to execute.

csrfProtection.title: CSRF Protection Disabled
csrfProtection.description: Without CSRF protection, your captcha system becomes vulnerable to cross-site request forgery attacks, allowing malicious websites to submit captcha solutions on behalf of users.

ipRateLimiting.title: IP Rate Limiting Disabled
ipRateLimiting.description: Turning off rate limiting allows attackers to make unlimited requests from the same IP address, making brute force attacks and spam much easier to execute.

automationDetection.title: Automation Detection Disabled
automationDetection.description: Without automation detection, bots can interact with your captcha without being detected, significantly reducing the effectiveness of your security measures.

behavioralAnalysis.title: Behavioral Analysis Disabled
behavioralAnalysis.description: Disabling behavioral analysis removes your ability to detect suspicious patterns in user interactions, making it harder to distinguish between humans and bots.

riskAdaptiveDifficulty.title: Risk-based Adaptive Difficulty Disabled
riskAdaptiveDifficulty.description: Without adaptive difficulty, all users receive the same challenge regardless of risk level, making it easier for attackers to solve captchas while potentially frustrating legitimate users with unnecessarily difficult challenges.

antiVpn.title: Anti-VPN Detection Disabled
antiVpn.description: Disabling VPN detection allows users from VPN networks to access your captcha. While this may improve accessibility, it also makes it easier for malicious actors to hide their true location and evade IP-based blocking.

mlScoring.title: ML/Bot Scoring Configuration
mlScoring.description: Advanced machine learning-based bot detection with neural network-like scoring
mlScoring.enableDescription: Use advanced machine learning algorithms for bot detection
mlScoring.sensitivityHelpText: Higher sensitivity = more strict bot detection
mlScoring.ensembleDescription: Combine multiple ML models for better accuracy

featureWeights.title: Feature Weights (Neural Network Layers)
featureWeights.description: Adjust the importance of each detection feature. Total should be ~1.0 for optimal results.

thresholds.title: Risk Score Thresholds
thresholds.description: Configure when to trigger challenges based on ML risk scores (0-100)

info.title: Advanced ML Features
info.description: The ML scoring system uses neural network-like weighted ensemble learning with 6 detection layers: Automation Detection, Behavioral Analysis, Device Fingerprinting, IP Reputation, Anomaly Detection, and Temporal Pattern Analysis.

saved.title: Settings Saved
saved.description: Security settings have been updated successfully.

error.title: Error
error.description: Failed to save settings. Please try again.

widgetCustomization.description: Customize widget appearance, branding, and behavior

customBrandText.label: Custom Brand Text
customBrandText.helpText: Custom text to display in widget footer

forceTheme.helpText: Override theme selection (only works if "Allow Theme Switch" is disabled)

widgetSize.helpText: Control the overall size of the widget

customWidth.helpText: Set custom widget width in pixels. Leave empty to use widget size preset

disableAnimations.label: Disable Animations
disableAnimations.description: Turn off all widget animations for better performance

animationSpeed.label: Animation Speed
animationSpeed.helpText: Control the speed of animations (ignored if animations are disabled)

userFeedback.title: User Feedback & Messages
userFeedback.description: Customize messages, feedback, and user experience

customErrorMessages.title: Custom Error Messages
customErrorMessages.description: Override default error messages with your own text. Leave blank to use defaults.

timeout.label: Timeout Error Message
timeout.placeholder: Challenge timed out. Please try again.

countryBlocked.label: Country Blocked Message
countryBlocked.placeholder: Access from your country is not allowed.

customSuccessMessage.label: Custom Success Message
customSuccessMessage.helpText: Message shown when verification is successful

showComputationCount.label: Show Computation Count
showComputationCount.description: Display proof-of-work computation count in success message

customLoadingMessage.label: Custom Loading Message
customLoadingMessage.helpText: Message shown while challenge is loading

showProgressBar.label: Show Progress Bar
showProgressBar.description: Display progress bar during proof-of-work computation

enableSoundEffects.label: Enable Sound Effects
enableSoundEffects.description: Play sounds for success and error events

successSoundUrl.label: Success Sound URL
successSoundUrl.helpText: Audio file to play on successful verification

errorSoundUrl.label: Error Sound URL
errorSoundUrl.helpText: Audio file to play on error or failure

challengeBehavior.title: Challenge Behavior
challengeBehavior.description: Control how challenges are presented and handled

maxAutoRetries.label: Max Auto Retries
maxAutoRetries.helpText: Maximum number of automatic retry attempts

selectionMode.label: Selection Mode
selectionMode.helpText: How challenges are selected for users

preferredChallengeType.label: Preferred Challenge Type
preferredChallengeType.helpText: Override selection mode with a specific challenge type

allowSkip.label: Skip Challenge for Trusted Users
allowSkip.description: Allow bypassing challenges for recognized, trusted fingerprints

trustThreshold.label: Trust Threshold (Days)
trustThreshold.helpText: Number of days before a fingerprint is considered trusted (1-365)

performanceOptimization.title: Performance Optimization
performanceOptimization.description: Optimize loading, caching, and resource usage

preloadChallenges.label: Preload Challenges
preloadChallenges.description: Load next challenge in background for faster transitions

cacheValidTokens.label: Cache Valid Tokens
cacheValidTokens.description: Cache verified tokens to reduce server requests

tokenCacheDuration.helpText: How long to cache valid tokens (60-900 seconds)

enableCompression.label: Enable Compression
enableCompression.description: Compress widget resources for faster loading

useCDN.label: Use CDN
useCDN.description: Load resources from CDN for better performance and availability

cdnUrl.label: Custom CDN URL
cdnUrl.helpText: Optional custom CDN URL for widget resources

maxWorkerThreads.label: Max Worker Threads
maxWorkerThreads.helpText: Maximum number of web worker threads for parallel processing (1-8)

workerFallback.label: Worker Fallback
workerFallback.description: Automatically fallback to main thread if web workers are not supported

alert.description: Try ProofCaptcha with multiple challenge types: grid selection, jigsaw puzzles, gesture drawing, and upside-down text. Challenges adapt based on risk detection.

quickStart.title: Quick Start Guide
quickStart.description: Get up and running in minutes

step1.title: 1. Get Your API Keys
step1.descriptionPart1: Navigate to the API Keys page and create a new key for your website. You'll receive a

step2.title: 2. Add to Your Frontend
step2.description: Include the ProofCaptcha script in your HTML and render the widget (see Frontend tab).

step3.title: 3. Verify on Backend
step3.description: When user submits the form, verify the CAPTCHA token on your server (see Backend tab).

step1.title: 1. Get Your API Keys
step1.description: Register and create an API key from your dashboard. You'll need the public key (sitekey) for your frontend.

step2.title: 2. Load the ProofCaptcha Script
step2.description: Add this script tag to your HTML page. The widget will auto-render elements with class "proof-captcha".

step3.title: 3. Add Auto-Render Widget (Recommended)
step3.description: Simply add a div with class "proof-captcha" and data attributes. The widget renders automatically!

step4.title: 4. Manual Render (Alternative)
step4.description: You can also manually render the widget using JavaScript API.

backend.title: Backend Verification
backend.description: Verify CAPTCHA tokens securely on your server

alert.title: Backend Validation is Required
alert.description: The api.js widget does NOT validate tokens. You must verify tokens on your backend server using the /proofCaptcha/api/siteverify endpoint to prevent bots from bypassing CAPTCHA.

step2.title: User Solves:
step2.description: User completes the puzzle (grid, jigsaw, gesture, or upside down) in the browser

step3.title: Solution Verification:
step3.description: api.js submits the solution to backend, which validates and returns a verification token (JWT)

step4.title: Your Backend Validates:
step4.description: Your server sends the verification token to {{endpoint}} with your secret key

step5.title: Process Request:
step5.description: Only after siteverify returns success, process the user's form/request

challenge.title: Challenge Token:
challenge.description: Ephemeral token used internally by api.js during the solve process. Never exposed to developers.

verification.title: Verification Token (JWT):
verification.description: Signed token returned to your frontend after successful solve. This is what you send to siteverify from your backend.

errors.missingSecret: Secret key is missing from the request
errors.invalidSecret: Secret key is invalid or incorrect
errors.missingResponse: Verification token is missing from the request
errors.invalidResponse: Verification token is invalid, expired, or already used
errors.timeoutDuplicate: Token has expired or has been verified before

crypto.title: End-to-End Encryption
crypto.description: ECDH + AES-256-GCM protects challenge data from inspection and tampering

validation.title: Domain Validation
validation.description: Strict domain restrictions prevent unauthorized API key usage

pow.title: Proof-of-Work
pow.description: Computational challenges make automated attacks expensive

fingerprint.title: Device Fingerprinting
fingerprint.description: Multi-layer tracking identifies and blocks suspicious patterns

encryption.title: End-to-End Encryption (ECDH + AES-256-GCM)
encryption.description: All challenge data is encrypted in transit using Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) key exchange combined with AES-256-GCM authenticated encryption. This ensures that even if network traffic is intercepted, attackers cannot read or tamper with challenge parameters.
encryption.benefit3: Guarantees data integrity with authentication tags

fingerprinting.title: Advanced Device Fingerprinting
fingerprinting.description: Multi-layer fingerprinting system that uniquely identifies devices across sessions using various browser characteristics.

canvas.title: Canvas:
canvas.description: Unique visual rendering variations per device

riskScoring.title: Adaptive Risk Scoring
riskScoring.description: Dynamic scoring system that adjusts challenge difficulty based on user behavior.

ipBlocking.title: IP Blocking & Reputation
ipBlocking.description: Multi-layer IP reputation system with automatic and manual blocking.

automatic.title: Automatic Blocking:
automatic.description: IPs with suspicious behavior are temporarily blocked

manual.title: Manual Blocking:
manual.description: Developers can block specific IPs or countries

behavioral.title: Behavioral Analysis
behavioral.description: Analysis of user interaction patterns to detect bots.

request.title: Request Patterns:
request.description: Suspicious frequency and sequence of requests

userAgent.title: User Agent Consistency:
userAgent.description: Detection of fake or inconsistent user agents

antiDebugger.title: Anti-Debugger Protection
antiDebugger.description: Detect and prevent DevTools usage for reverse engineering the widget.

alert.title: Important Notice
alert.description: This feature can be disabled for development debugging. However, it is highly recommended to ALWAYS enable it in production to prevent reverse engineering.

fingerprinting.title: Advanced Device Fingerprinting
fingerprinting.description: Multi-layer fingerprinting system that uniquely identifies devices across sessions using multiple browser characteristics.
fingerprinting.audio: Audio context fingerprinting (audio processing unique ID)
fingerprinting.screen: Screen parameters (resolution, color depth, pixel ratio)
fingerprinting.usage1: Detect suspicious patterns across multiple IP addresses
fingerprinting.usage2: Identify automated browsers and virtual machines
fingerprinting.usage4: Adaptive difficulty based on risk score

antiBot.title: Anti-Bot Detection Suite
antiBot.description: Multiple techniques detect automation tools and headless browsers before challenge generation.
antiBot.check6: Missing browser APIs that real users have
antiBot.action: Automated browsers are blocked before receiving challenges, making bot development significantly harder.

rateLimit.title: Adaptive Rate Limiting
rateLimit.description: Dynamic request throttling based on IP reputation and fingerprint patterns.
rateLimit.failed: Failed attempts: 10/hour per fingerprint before lockout
rateLimit.behavior: The system automatically increases difficulty for suspicious IPs and fingerprints while maintaining smooth UX for legitimate users.

replayPrevention.title: Challenge Replay Prevention
replayPrevention.description: Every challenge and verification token is single-use with strict expiration and binding.
replayPrevention.mechanism2: Tokens can only be verified once
replayPrevention.mechanism5: Session binding ties challenges to specific fingerprints

csrfProtection.title: CSRF & Session Binding
csrfProtection.description: Challenges are bound to the session and fingerprint that requested them.
csrfProtection.protection1: Challenges are tied to the requesting session
csrfProtection.protection2: Fingerprint matching ensures same device completes the challenge
csrfProtection.protection3: CSRF tokens prevent cross-site request forgery
csrfProtection.protection4: IP consistency checks detect proxy switching

threatModel.title: Attack Vector Analysis
threatModel.description: How ProofCaptcha defends against common attack patterns

tokenReplay.title: Token Replay Attack
tokenReplay.description: Reusing previously valid tokens to bypass verification
tokenReplay.mitigations: Single-use tokens, JWT expiration, Session binding

crossDomain.title: Cross-Domain Abuse
crossDomain.description: Attempting to use tokens from unauthorized domains

botFarm.title: Automation / Bot Farms
botFarm.description: Using headless browsers or automation tools to solve challenges
botFarm.mitigations: Webdriver detection, Device fingerprinting, Behavioral analysis

brute.title: Brute Force / Automated Solving
brute.description: Attacker uses automated tools to rapidly solve challenges
brute.mitigations: Proof-of-work computation, Bot detection, Rate limiting, Device fingerprinting

token.title: Token Replay Attack
token.description: Reusing previously valid tokens to bypass verification
token.mitigations: Single-use tokens, JWT expiration, Challenge-token binding

mitm.title: Man-in-the-Middle
mitm.description: Intercepting and modifying challenge data in transit
mitm.mitigations: ECDH key exchange, AES-256-GCM encryption, HMAC verification

tampering.title: Challenge Tampering
tampering.description: Attacker modifies challenge parameters to reduce difficulty
tampering.mitigations: HMAC verification, JWT signing, Server-side validation

ddos.title: DDoS / Request Flooding
ddos.description: Overwhelming the service with excessive requests
ddos.mitigations: Rate limiting, IP blocking, Request throttling

csrf.title: CSRF Attack
csrf.description: Malicious site tricks user into submitting forms
csrf.mitigations: CSRF tokens, Double-submit cookie, SameSite cookies

sessionHijack.title: Session Hijacking
sessionHijack.description: Token stolen and replayed from different device/IP
sessionHijack.mitigations: Session fingerprinting, Device tracking, IP consistency

solverFarms.title: CAPTCHA Solver Farms
solverFarms.description: Human or AI farms solving challenges for bots

defenseAlert.title: Defense-in-Depth Approach
defenseAlert.description: ProofCaptcha uses multiple overlapping security layers. Even if one layer is bypassed, other layers provide protection. This makes successful attacks exponentially more difficult and costly for attackers.

bestPractices.title: Developer Best Practices
bestPractices.description: Follow these recommendations to maximize security when integrating ProofCaptcha

practice1.title: Secure API Key Storage
practice1.description: Never expose your secret key in frontend code or version control. Store it in environment variables or secure vaults.

practice2.title: Always Verify on Backend
practice2.description: Even though challenges are proof-of-work based, always verify the token on your backend before processing sensitive operations.

practice3.title: Use Domain Restrictions
practice3.description: Configure specific domains for your API keys instead of using wildcards (*). This prevents unauthorized use.

practice4.title: Monitor Verification Logs
practice4.description: Regularly review verification logs in your dashboard to detect suspicious patterns or abuse attempts.

practice5.title: Implement Rate Limiting
practice5.description: Add your own rate limiting on top of ProofCaptcha's built-in protection for critical endpoints.

practice6.title: Rotate Keys Periodically
practice6.description: Generate new API keys periodically and deprecate old ones to minimize the impact of potential key leaks.

practice7.title: Handle Errors Gracefully
practice7.description: Implement proper error handling for CAPTCHA failures and provide clear user feedback without exposing security details.

practice8.title: Test in Staging First
practice8.description: Always test CAPTCHA integration in a staging environment before deploying to production.

monitoringAlert.title: Security Monitoring
monitoringAlert.description: ProofCaptcha logs all verification attempts with IP addresses, user agents, and timestamps. Use the dashboard analytics to monitor for unusual patterns or potential attacks.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: ProofCaptcha ("we," "us," or "our") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our CAPTCHA service.

technical.title: 2.1 Technical Information
items: IP address
Browser type and version
Operating system
Device fingerprint (for security purposes)
Timestamp of verification attempts

interaction.title: 2.2 Interaction Data
items: Challenge type presented
Time to solve challenges
Success/failure status of verification attempts
Mouse movements and interaction patterns (for bot detection)

developer.title: 2.3 Developer Account Information
items: Email address
Account credentials (encrypted)
API keys and usage statistics

howWeUse.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
howWeUse.intro: We use the collected information for:
items: Distinguishing humans from bots
Preventing automated abuse and spam
Improving our security algorithms
Analyzing service performance and usage patterns
Providing customer support to developers
Detecting and preventing security threats

dataSecurity.title: 4. Data Storage and Security
dataSecurity.intro: We implement industry-standard security measures to protect your data:
items: End-to-end encryption for challenge data (ECDH + AES-256-GCM)
Encrypted storage of sensitive information
Regular security audits and updates
Automatic deletion of expired verification data
Rate limiting and DDoS protection

dataRetention.title: 5. Data Retention
dataRetention.intro: We retain different types of data for different periods:
items: Challenge tokens: Expire after 5 minutes
Verification logs: Retained for 30 days for analytics
Developer account data: Retained until account deletion
IP blocklist data: Automatically cleared based on violation severity

thirdParty.title: 6. Third-Party Sharing
thirdParty.content: We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to third parties. We may share aggregated, anonymized statistics with website owners who use our service to help them understand their traffic patterns.

cookies.title: 7. Cookies and Tracking
cookies.content: ProofCaptcha uses session cookies to maintain state during the verification process. These cookies are essential for the service to function and expire when you close your browser or after the verification is complete.

yourRights.title: 8. Your Rights
items: Access your personal data
Request correction of inaccurate data
Request deletion of your account and associated data
Object to data processing
Export your data in a portable format

children.title: 9. Children's Privacy
children.content: ProofCaptcha does not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. Our service is designed for use on websites that may be accessed by users of all ages, but we do not directly target children.

changes.title: 10. Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify developers of any material changes via email. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contact.title: 11. Contact Us
contact.content: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us at privacy@proofcaptcha.com

agreement.title: 1. Agreement to Terms
agreement.content: By accessing or using ProofCaptcha ("Service"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service ("Terms"). If you disagree with any part of these terms, you may not access the Service.

description.title: 2. Description of Service
description.intro: ProofCaptcha provides a proof-of-work based CAPTCHA system designed to:
items: Distinguish human users from automated bots
Protect websites from spam and abuse
Provide analytics on verification attempts
Offer customizable challenge types

registration.title: 3. Account Registration
registration.intro: To use ProofCaptcha as a developer, you must:
items: Provide accurate and complete registration information
Maintain the security of your account credentials
Promptly update your account information if it changes
Be responsible for all activities under your account
Not share your API keys with unauthorized parties

youMay.title: 4.1 You May:
items: Integrate ProofCaptcha into your websites and applications
Use the service for legitimate bot protection
Access analytics and verification data for your domains
Customize the appearance and behavior of CAPTCHA widgets

youMayNot.title: 4.2 You May Not:
items: Attempt to bypass, reverse engineer, or disable the CAPTCHA system
Use the service for illegal activities or to violate others' rights
Exceed rate limits or abuse the API
Resell or redistribute the service without authorization
Use automated tools to solve challenges at scale
Collect or harvest user data in violation of privacy laws

apiKeys.title: 5. API Keys and Security
items: Keep your secret keys confidential and secure
Use different keys for development and production environments
Rotate keys immediately if you suspect they've been compromised
Configure domain restrictions to prevent unauthorized use
Monitor your API key usage regularly

availability.title: 6. Service Availability
availability.content: While we strive to provide 99.9% uptime, ProofCaptcha is provided "as is" without warranties. We do not guarantee uninterrupted access and reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue the service at any time with or without notice.

rateLimits.title: 7. Rate Limits and Quotas
rateLimits.intro: The Service implements the following limits:
items: Challenge generation: 30 requests per minute per IP
Verification attempts: 60 requests per minute per IP
Failed attempts may result in temporary IP blocking
Excessive abuse may result in account suspension

ip.title: 8. Intellectual Property
ip.content: The ProofCaptcha service, including all software, designs, text, graphics, and other content, is owned by ProofCaptcha and protected by copyright and other intellectual property laws. You are granted a limited, non-exclusive license to use the service as described in these Terms.

privacyData.title: 9. Privacy and Data Protection
privacyData.content: Your use of ProofCaptcha is also governed by our Privacy Policy. By using the Service, you consent to the collection and use of information as described in the Privacy Policy.

liability.title: 10. Limitation of Liability
liability.content: ProofCaptcha shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages resulting from your use or inability to use the Service. Our total liability shall not exceed the amount paid by you (if any) for using the Service in the past 12 months.

indemnification.title: 11. Indemnification
indemnification.content: You agree to indemnify and hold ProofCaptcha harmless from any claims, damages, or expenses arising from your use of the Service, violation of these Terms, or infringement of any third-party rights.

termination.title: 12. Account Termination
termination.intro: We may terminate or suspend your account immediately if you:
items: Violate these Terms of Service
Engage in fraudulent or abusive behavior
Fail to respond to security concerns
Request account deletion

changesToTerms.title: 13. Changes to Terms
changesToTerms.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. Material changes will be notified via email to registered developers. Continued use of the Service after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified Terms.

governingLaw.title: 14. Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with applicable laws. Any disputes arising from these Terms or your use of the Service shall be resolved through binding arbitration.

contactInfo.title: 15. Contact Information
contactInfo.content: For questions about these Terms or the Service, please contact us at support@proofcaptcha.com

severability.title: 16. Severability
severability.content: If any provision of these Terms is found to be unenforceable or invalid, that provision shall be limited or eliminated to the minimum extent necessary so that these Terms shall otherwise remain in full force and effect.

chat.title: Developer Chat
chat.subtitle: Secure public chat • End-to-end WebSocket encryption
chat.noMessages: No messages yet. Start the conversation!
chat.messageInputPlaceholder: Type your message or @mention someone... (Shift+Enter to send)
chat.helpText: Use ```language for code blocks • @username to mention • Press Shift+Enter to send

errors.pleaseWait: Please wait for connection to be established
errors.mediaUploadFailed: Failed to upload media. Please try again.
errors.mediaUploadMaxSize: File size must be 10MB or less

avatar.fileSizeError: File size must be 2MB or less

validation.bioMaxLength: Bio must be 500 characters or less
validation.companyMaxLength: Company name must be 100 characters or less
validation.locationMaxLength: Location must be 100 characters or less

notFound.title: 404 - Page Not Found
notFound.description: The page you're looking for doesn't exist or has been moved.

captcha.blocked: Too many attempts. Please try again later.
captcha.completeJigsaw: Drag the piece to complete the puzzle
captcha.selectUpsideDown: Select all animals that are upside-down

toast.apiKeyCreated: API key created successfully. Save your secret key securely!
